data.title: Love this place
data.text: My husband and I make sure to visit about once every few months, and it's never disappointing.  The serving sizes are huge so make sure to come hungry!  You get potato pancakes, bread, cabbage, creamed spinach, plus a huge entrée and desert with your meal.  The menu is not very large, but still has lots of good options.  Everything is homemade and you can tell it's a family run business.  If you enjoy European cuisine, I highly recommend this for you!

data.title: ❤️
data.text: I went for lunch in this restaurant and I must say it was a lovely experience. I love how this place is run by the family and coming here you will feel the Hungarian vibe. The food was superb, everything is made out from scratch from the bread to salad dressing. They really stick to authentic Hungarian taste not a lot of condiments use in the food flavors comes naturally from the ingredients veces and the meat. I had the chicken paprikash it really meet my palate cravings for a Hungarian homemade cuisine.

data.title: Night Out with Friends
data.text:
We chose Uncle Lui's because of the excellent reviews. I was not disappointed.
It is a very small restaurant with limited seating. I would recommend making reservations. The wait staff was excellent . We received complimentary potato latkes and bread right away. I had the garlic chicken and my husband had the veal cordon bleu. The portions are very large and the food was delicious. Our drinks were refilled before they were empty . 
The waiter brought take out boxes to our table (we didn't have to ask) 
We also had dessert - apple strudel for me and cheesecake for my husband. Both delicious. The entrees are in the range of $20-30. 
The decor is older looking - but if you can get past that, you'll probably enjoy it.

data.title: Strongly suggest doing takeout!!
data.text:
I had reviewed this place a while back. The food is absolutely delicious! Great portion sizes, the spaetzel is to die for and the Lamb Shank wins every time!
However, we had visited once or twice and done take out and the maitre de had the lousiest attitude until this year - even degraded US for how the food was packed for takeout so lousily that it spilled on my parents' car one trip!

Lately, however - he's been on his best behavior, serves with a smile and seems to have taken the critique VERY seriously. Did take out from there last night and everyone was extremely pleased, even our six year old son loved the spaetzel and his grandma's chicken paprikash that was shared with him! 
Enough food for leftovers and very tasty!

data.title: Fresh and .... a lot of food
data.text: This family operated nice restaurant serves the food as if it was cooked by our grandma, big portions and includes delicious desserts, very inexpensive, friendly people, really really worth it !!!

data.title: Disappointing Entree/Good appetizer & strudel
data.text: I'm a roast duck lover but Uncle Lui's is NOT the place to order duck. Another Tripadvisor reviewer was spot on: the duck looked good but my duck was tough, chewy & tasteless and the "orange sauce" was weak. I was not a fan of their potato pancakes either. However, I did enjoy their chicken liver appetizer, as well as the apple strudel. I should mention that I took advantage of Uncle Lui's very reasonably-priced take-out menu, but again, after my disappointing duck entree, I am reluctant to return to Uncle Lui's.

data.title: Good Hungarian and East European food. Huge portions, family style and inexpensive!!!!
data.text: Very delicious food. The Chicken Paprikash was very good. The service was very good. Coffee and dessert included.

data.title: Great
data.text: Absolutely love this European style restaurant. Small.  Never feel rushed.  Most sides are served family style and are excellent.  Portions are huge.  Take home for sure.  I loved the enormous porting of Vienna snitzel which I  had with home fries, the best I ever tasted. Their creamed spinach, red cabbage were awesome.   I had enough left over for a dinner and lunch.  Will definitely go back now that the snowbirds have gone back north.  I am going to get take out as my northern friends went back.  You must order at 3:30 before they open and for TAKE OUT ONLY CASH.  If you eat in credit cards are accepted.

data.title: Cry Uncle
data.text: Yes, the portions are large!  Depending on what you order, you have enough to take home for another meal!  Corn chowder average.  Potato soup missing onion flavor like my Hungarian Grandma made it.  Two schnitzel cutlets take up the whole plate.  Lots of flavorless spaetzle under it.  Duck moist with crisp skin, but also flavorless, and the sauce on the side, unidentifiable, and not much help.  Complementary creamed spinach VERY watery and strange flavor.  Complementary red cabbage very vinegary and bitter. Basket of a variety of rolls dry and non-descript.  Large apple strudel for dessert.  Happy that my husband could have a sugar-free one, but mine tasted flat and sugar-free too, with only the addition of powdered sugar (and whipped cream) on top!  The crust was thick and flavorless.  Service was quick and attentive.  Coffee was very good.  Ambiance authentic.  Still searching for quality Hungarian food, not quantity.

data.title: Very good
data.text: You cant find any restaurant that gives you the quantity and quality. that you get at this restaurant.

data.title: Lots of Food
data.text: You can't see this restaurant from the road. You have to drive into a strip mall off Oakland Park Blvd. We were there for dinner and it was not crowded.  We had the potato pancake, the weiner schnitzel and the chicken paprikash with apple strudel for dessert.  Everything was delicious. Every portion was oversized. We always look for Eastern European restaurants on our vacations and this was one of the best.  You'll be paying for one meal, but getting at least two meals.

data.title: Delicious
data.text: Excellent dinner. I had vienershnitzel and my husband had the veal goulash.  Huge portions.  Will be back

data.title: Massive Mountains of Food
data.text: Friendly, tasty Hungarian dishes. Daily specials. Good service. Helpful advice. Family restaurant. Nothing fancy. From main courses of liver, veal, chicken, fish, and more, the plates are laden. The pea soup was so good. The veal schnitzel, fabulous. Veal and chicken goulash, too. Good strudel for dessert.

data.title: Wish I could rate it higher!
data.text:
The food is outstanding and the portions are great sized. We have had great luck with takeout though the containers are not loaded with care and spills occur easily.
There may be a great ambiance but that is tough to discover with at least one major server or maitre d who is absolutely mean and rude to all who come in.
Do yourself a favor and order takeout!

data.title: Excellent
data.text: I get the Veal Wiener Schnitzel Excellent. The portions are enormous. They start with a Potato Pancake, Then Soup, Bread, Veal , and finish with Desert.

data.title: A REAL FAMILY RESTAURANT
data.text: I went with wife and some friends, it was my 4th. visit, and must say, it is a great "Hungarian style restaurant", managed by parents and son and daughter. To plates are so big, 90% of them, you take a "doggy bag". since they offer with each one, salad or soup, dessert and coffee. (Plus while you look at the menu, a huge "latkej" -Sorry, not sure of the spelling-(Onion and potato grated, mixed and fried like ash brown}. Wine and beer at a very reasonable price, as well as the food itself. I do recommend it

data.title: Good eastern-european food
data.text: I chose this place for my birthday.  Its good with a group as they have a fixed price menu if you arrive early.  This includes main dish, soup or salad, various sides (served family style), potato pancake, desert and tea or coffee.   The menu is limited but I most always get the schnitzel.  I think they are only open for dinner.

data.title: Hidden Gem!!!
data.text: Great food,  excellent service. Highly recommended for of lovers of European style cuisine. Unbelievable quality and quantity for the price.

data.title: I'll (Pass) on this one, better options out there ...
data.text: The food was bland and not very good, if you are looking for quantity versus quality - go there, if not then avoid.  Old looking interior, owner not very friendly, talks to you like you don't know the food menu since it's ethnic / European type.  I'll pass, better out there than this place...Sometimes homemade is not the best choice - looking for Chef quality, not quantity.

data.title: A little bit of Europe
data.text: If you want a complete meal at a reasonable price, with a taste of Hungary, this is the place for you . Veal, rabbit, or whatever is on the menu the day you visit is fresh. Generally, you will go home wit a "doggy bag" because they serve a lot of food for the price.
